thread.title: Notre Dame's Mirams wins District 11 AA title
thread.title_full: Notre Dame's Mirams wins District 11 AA title

title: Notre Dame's Mirams wins District 11 AA title
text: Notre Dame's Mirams wins District 11 AA title Cardinals top Mounties, 2-1, in boys soccer Comment Posted Oct. 12, 2015 at 9:01 PM Posted Oct. 12, 2015 at 9:01 PM Â» Social News ORWIGSBURG - William Mirams of Notre Dame ES shot a 71 to win the District 11 AA boys championship on Monday at Schuylkill Country Club. Mirams is the third-ever freshman to win a District 11 golf championship. Mirams will advance to the PIAA East Region tournament at Golden Oaks Golf Club in Fleetwood on Monday. Mirams' one-under par 71 led Notre Dame ES to a second-place finish in the AA team championship. Matthew McGinley shot an 85, Krista Kissell shot 90, Brendan Murphy 93, and Dylan Dembinski shot 104 for Notre Dame. Kissell's 90 was good for third place in the girls AA individual results. In the District 11 AAA championship, Tim Gaudette of PM West shot a 77 to finish fourth and qualified for the PIAA East region tournament at Golden Oaks as well. Brian Whelan of PM East shot an 80 for ninth place and Brian Frey of Stroudsburg was 13th with an 82. Frey led Stroudsburg to fourth place in the AAA team championships. Stroudsburg combined for 358 strokes in the team championship (Frey 82, Jack Mullally 88, Adam Moninghoff 92, Sam Ewing 96). Maegan Haser and Molly Agnello of PM East finished sixth and seventh in the AAA girls championship. District XI AA boys results 1. William Mirams (NDES) 71, 2. Nick Maff (BC) 72, 3. Cory Haldeman (MA), 4. Colin McQueen (MA) 77, 5. Bobby Beck (MA) 79. 6. Drew Warner (MA) 81, 7. Hunter Mickatavage (NS) 82, 8. Matthew McGinley (NDES) 85, 9. Luke Reiter (PG) 86, 9. Andrew Benner (P) 86. District XI AAA boys results 1. Max Harrington (EMM) 73, 2. Paul Fedele (EAS) 75, 3. Kevin Scherr (NAZ) 77, 4. Tim Gaudette (PMW) 77, 5. Nick Atherholt (NAZ) 77, 6. Kevin Caverly (EMM) 78, 7. Alec Cwienkala (PARK) 79, 7. Jacob Siegfried (L), 9. Brian Whelan (PME) 80. 10. Nick Hinkle (NAZ) 81. AA team results 1. Moravian Academy 310, 2. Notre Dame ES 339, 3. Bethlehem Catholic 356, 3. Marian Catholic 356. AAA team results 1. Emmaus 305, 2. Nazareth 320, 3. Blue Mt. 337, 4. Stroudsburg 358. Boys Soccer PM East 2, Stroudsburg 1 SWIFTWATER - Doug Goitia and Zach Gothard scored goals to lead Pocono Mountain East to a 2-1 victory over Stroudsburg on Monday in Eastern Pennsylvania Conference boys soccer. PM East 2, Stroudsburg 1 Stroudsburg 0 1 - 1 PM East 1 1 - 2 Goals - S, John Burns. PME, Doug Goitia, Zach Gothard. Assists - PME, Matt Bolock. Shots - S 6, PME 7. Corners - S 2, PME 3. Saves - S Luc Cibischino 1, PME Mike Bone 1. Records: PM East 14-2 (13-2 EPC), Stroudsburg 11-5 (10-5 EPC). Volleyball PM West 3, ES North 1 POCONO SUMMIT-- PM West defeated ES North 20-25, 25-19, 25-11 and 25-22. Asiah Leonard led the Panthers with eight kills. Mackenzie Seitz added ten digs and six aces. Other Scores Field Hockey ES South 1, Pen Argyl 0 PEN ARGYL - Brianne Maluda recorded a seven-save shutout in net and Madi Krajewski scored to lead ES South to a 1-0 win over Pen Argyl in non-conference field hockey Monday. ES South 1, Pen Argyl 0 ES South 0 1 - 1 Pen Argyl 0 0 - 0 Goals - ESS, Madi Krajewski. Assists - ESS, Taylor Gramberg. Shots - ESS 3, PA 16. Saves - ESS Brianne Maluda 7, PA Kasey Hanlon 1. Rec Golf Hole in one Joe Catanzaro made a hole in one on No. 2 at Glen Brook Golf Club using a 5-wood. Jim Reynolds, Pete Bedrosian and George Primiano witnessed the shot. Today's Sports ES South at PM West, 4 p.m. PM East at Stroudsburg, 4 p.m. ES North at Pleasant Valley, 4 p.m. BOYS SOCCER PM West at ES South, 4 p.m. GIRLS SOCCER ES South at PM West, 4 p.m. ES North at Pleasant Valley, 5:30 p.m. CROSS COUNTRY PM East/Pleasant Valley/ES South/Stroudsburg/PM West at ES North, 4 p.m. Notre Dame ES at Salisbury, 4 p.m. poconorecord.com
